alert.note: Alert for Okanogan Highlands; Okanogan Valley; Waterville Plateau; Western Okanogan County (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued November 06 at 3:51AM PST until November 07 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST MONDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations below 3000 feet between 7 and 15 inches. Total snow accumulations above 3000 feet between 12 and 24 inches. * WHERE...Oroville, Mazama, Disautel Pass, Badger Mountain Road, Winthrop, Conconully, Methow, Nespelem, Inchelium, Wauconda, Boulder Creek Road, Omak, Waterville, Loup Loup Pass, Twisp, Highway 20 Wauconda Summit, Republic, Mansfield, Okanogan, Sherman Pass, Brewster, Bridgeport, and Chesaw Road. * WHEN...Until 10 AM PST Monday. * IMPACTS...The strong winds and weight of snow on tree limbs may down power lines and could cause sporadic power outages. Travel could be very difficult. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow levels will increase to 1500 to 2000 feet Sunday afternoon with snow transitioning to a rain/snow mix before transitioning back to snow Sunday evening and overnight.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. Do not touch downed lines and report any power outages to your electric company.

area.areaDesc: Okanogan Highlands; Okanogan Valley; Waterville Plateau; Western Okanogan County
